text: Scientific RePoRtS | (2018) 8:2752 | DOI:10.1038/s41598-018-21058-w A range of far-UVC exposures, from 3.6 ÂµJ/cm 2 up to 281.6 mJ/cm 2 , were used to define a response calibration curve. Films were scanned as 48 bit RGB TIFF images at 150 dpi using an Epson Perfection V700 Photo flatbed scanner (Epson, Japan) and analyzed with radiochromic film analysis software 32 to calculate the total exposure based on measured changes in optical density.
